data.title: Non-standard scrolling rate in 1.19.6 on macOS
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Since upgrading from to 1.19.6 on macOS, I've noticed that the scrolling "rate" has slowed down considerably. By "rate", I mean the y-position delta per scroll event. It's hard to measure precisely, but if I compare 1.19.6 to the previous version, or any other native scrolling application (e.g. a browser), the same finger movement on my trackpad results in about 1/3 the movement. Scrolling *isn't* lagging or stuttering; it's just not shifting the viewport by the standard amount (i.e. it takes much longer to scroll through a large text file).

### Steps to Reproduce

1. open a new editor
2. fill it with dummy text
3. scroll around using the trackpad
4. compare to scrolling around in a browser or previous Atom version

**Expected behavior:** the scrolling rate should be standard across all viewports

**Actual behavior:** the scrolling rate is much lower in 1.19.6

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

atom 1.19.6
apm 1.18.4
macOS 10.12.6

### Additional Information

I'm using a high-DPI retina display; I don't have a standard display to test on so I'm not sure if this is related to the issue.

data.title: Update ScopeDescriptor links
data.body: It's https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.19.6/TextEditor, not https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.19.6/Editor :wink:

data.title: Select all automatically unfolds any folded content
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

When performing a select-all, any folded content is automatically unfolded.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Fold some content
2. Select all

**Expected behavior:**

Folded content remains folded (but is available as part of any cut/copy/paste operations)

**Actual behavior:**

Folded content unfolds

**Reproduces how often:**

100%

### Versions

Atom    : 1.19.6
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0
OS: Windows 10 64 bit

### Additional Information

Note that when you highlight a folded section by dragging the mouse over it, it remains folded, and its contents are available for cut/copy/paste operations.

data.title: Inconsistent spacing between UI widgets in Settings > Themes
data.body: ### Prerequisites * [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/ * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages ### Description In Settings > Themes, the spacing between the UI Theme dropdown and its gearbox ("A" in screenshot below) is larger than the spacing between the Syntax Theme dropdown and its gearbox ("B" in screenshot below). ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Open Settings > Themes **Expected behavior:** Same spacing between dropdown and gearbox for both UI Theme and Syntax Theme. **Actual behavior:** Different spacing between dropdown and gearbox for UI Theme and Syntax Theme. **Reproduces how often:** 100% ### Versions Atom 1.19.5 on MacOS Sierra 10.12.6 ### Additional Information * Active UI theme appears to have no effect. * Window width appears to have no effect.

data.title: Crashing every few seconds. Android Studio unstaged changes.
data.body:
Hi all, 

I ran through the debugging report. I have run Atom on safe mode and checked to make sure I have the most updated version of atom. I was working on a new project last night with no issues. Early today, I started to edit the file, and atom crashed. I checked the window for any clue of what might have happened, and a new window appeared on my screen called git. It listed over 1000 unstaged changes from Android studio. The only thing I can think to do next is to clear the save state or return to factory settings, but I don't want to lose all my data. I'm unsure about what changed between yesterday and today. It did not crash at all yesterday. I have attached a screenshot below.

![screenshot 7](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23300893/30125710-f0721a1c-92fe-11e7-85c4-50c72dcb0d68.png) 

**Expected behavior:** When I open up Atom, I expect the program not to crash a few seconds after I make a change.

**Actual behavior:** The git window is filled with unstaged changes relating to android studio after I make any change to Atom. Atom then crashes. This has never happened before, I have had android studio installed the entire time I have had atom installed (a few months). 

**Reproduces how often:** Every time I open up Atom and click, or type, 100%.


<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

data.title: Editor scrollbars not visible
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

When scrollbars are set to appear "Automatically based on mouse or trackpad" in System Preferences, no scrollbars are shown in the editor in Atom. Scrollbars are still visible and act normally in the tree view and in Preferences.

When scrollbars are set to appear "Always" in System Preferences, normal system scrollbars are visible in the tree view. Only after closing and opening a file will a stylized scrollbar (not a system scrollbar) appear in the editor.

[I've recorded this issue here](https://vid.me/12D2Y).

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Set scrollbars to appear "Automatically based on mouse or trackpad"
2. (scrollbars don't appear in editor)
3. Set scrollbars to appear "Always"
4. Close and open file.
5. (non-standard stylized scrollbar appears in editor)

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
Scrollbars appear automatically or when scrolling.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
Scrollbars don't appear automatically or when scrolling.

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
All the time. I have uninstalled and reinstalled Atom, tried it with and without safe mode on, checked the styles.less file, and more. Any other suggestions are welcome.

### Versions
Atom 1.19.5 on MacOS 10.12.6.

### Additional Information

[Screen recording of this issue](https://vid.me/12D2Y).

data.title: Add the TextEditor.element to the public API
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

I would like to request that the `TextEditor.element` property be added to the public API, because it contains very helpful methods for package development such as the `getFirstVisibleScreenRow()` and `getLastVisibleScreenRow()`, which return which are the lines that are currently visible in an editor.

Note: I am also using these methods on my own package: [srt-helper](https://atom.io/packages/srt-helper). Previously I was using the `TextEditor.presenter.startRow` and `TextEditor.presenter.endRow` properties, but since the `presenter` no longer exists I had to start using the `element` property. This is another reason that I would like to request that the `TextEditor.element` be added to the public API: so that my package remains stable on the next versions of Atom.

### Steps to Reproduce

N/A

### Versions

Atom    : 1.19.5
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0
OS: Windows 10

### Additional Information

Link to discussion in the Atom forums: https://discuss.atom.io/t/how-to-get-visible-lines-numbers-in-atom-editor/47065/7

data.title: Atom fails to load package preferences in settings-tab
data.body:
Hello,

I am working on a package for my company.

Currently I am having trouble with the config of my package.
Config in my main module looks as follows:
```coffeescript
Main =
  config:
    FirstSetting:
      title: 'Some First Setting'
      description: 'This is the first setting to make'
      type: 'integer'
      default: 1
    SecondSetting:
      title: 'Some second setting'
      description: 'This definitly has to be done second'
      type: 'integer'
      default: 2

  subscriptions: null
  
  activate: (state) -> ...

# ...
# ...

module.exports = Main
```
My problem is, that atom does not load the packages config into the settings view.
Navigating to `Settings/Packages/my-package` results in an errormessage being displayed, telling me, that it `Failed to load my-package - try again later.`.
On the other hand the package works. Config settings are being loaded correctly (in code) and methods are also called and executed properly.

This is no general bug for my atom-installation. It only occures on custom packages. I also want to point out, that this probably has nothing to do with package-activation, because I already removed the `activationCommands` from `package.json` so that the package is activated immediately.
Anyone got an idea?

data.title: Use the Node version bundled in Electron to verify snapshot script
data.body:
Previously, we used to verify the snapshot script by running it in a new, empty context (similar to the one that `mksnapshot` creates when generating the startup blob).

However, this context was being created using the Node version that `script/build` was executed with. Such version may not match the Node version shipped with Electron, and could thus cause the build script to report "false negatives" when verifying the snapshot script. For instance, running `script/build` with Node 4 would cause it to throw an error when encountering keywords like `async`/`await`, even if they're 100% supported in Electron 1.6.9.

With this pull-request we are changing the snapshot verification code to use the Node version bundled in Electron in order to avoid the aforementioned mismatches.

@damieng @leroix: I believe this will fix the errors you were encountering on #15554.

/cc: @atom/maintainers

data.title: replace async/await with promises
data.body: The version of node that the snapshot tool uses doesn't support es7 features, so I've attempted to remove async/await from `dg-package-async-deactivate`. This should work, but I haven't tested.

data.title: Takes a lot of time to open
data.body:
I am currently having windows 10 and have installed atom for the same. While other text editors like sublime and adobe brackets open instantly, atom on other hand, takes forever to open. After clicking open on atom, I can open the browser, go to the desired website, take out and read the challenge that I have to code for and even then wait for it to open.
I am in love with its functionality, but the only thing that bothers me about atom is that it takes too much of time just to open.
Kindly fix it.

data.title: Allow Promises to be returned by a packages deactivate method
Fetching outdated node-temp package by installation
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description
By installation of Atom the old (0.7.0) version of temp packages installed. This leads to deprecation warnings in console "DeprecationWarning: os.tmpDir() is deprecated. Use os.tmpdir() instead.".
This warning  was refrenced in the following  #issues:
https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/14057
https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13476
https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13225
https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13361

### Steps to Reproduce
1. For windows: download and install AtomSetup-x64.exe
2. Look at .....\atom\app-XXX\resources\app\node_modules\temp (where  XXX is a version of atom e.g. 1.19.3) for version in package.json

**Expected behavior:** version should be as stated in ....\atom\app-1.19.3\resources\app\package.json at least ^0.8.3

**Actual behavior:** version is 0.7.0

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions
atom --version
Atom    : 1.19.3
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm --version
Atom    : 1.19.3
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

OS: Win 8.1 x64

### Additional Information
This is most likely due to the fact that atom-package-manager still uses version 0.7.0 of the temp package:
....\atom\app-XXX\resources\app\apm\package.json requires "temp": "~0.7.0"

data.title: Opening a split causes original pane's scroll position to reset
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

After splitting a pane, the original pane's scroll position appears to reset to (0, 0).  This is most noticeable when attempting to horizontally scroll the original pane.

![file-position-reset](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2766036/30082487-40ddbd90-928b-11e7-8794-4d6f1605eaa1.gif)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a file
2. `pane:split-<direction>-and-copy-active-item` (note: I have only tested with `right`)
3. If there is no horizontal scrollbar, resize the panes so that the original pane can be horizontally scrolled
4. Look at the scrollbar positions of the original pane and then attempt to horizontally scroll

**Expected behavior:** Scrollbars to correctly represent where the current file is, and for horizontally scrolling to horizontally scroll the file while maintaining the vertical position

**Actual behavior:** Both scrollbars reset to (0, 0) - that is, the vertical scrollbar resets to the top and the horizontal scrollbar resets to the left.  When attempting to horizontally scroll, the file position is reset to the top of the file.

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions
```
Atom    : 1.22.0-dev-700fdc592
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0
```

/cc: @as-cii @nathansobo

data.title: Update language-coffee-script to v0.49.0
data.body:
Introduces a very large overhaul of the language-coffee-script grammar, bringing it up-to-date with language-javascript.

language-html contains a temporary spec fix.

data.title: Don't render block decorations located outside the visible range
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/15441

Previously, when trying to use block decorations on non-empty markers, Atom could sometimes throw an error if such markers ended or started at a position that was not currently rendered.

In fact, even if we already restricted the decoration query to markers that intersected the visible row range, markers that were only partially visible would still be considered for rendering. If, depending on the `reversed` property, we decided to render the tail or head of the marker in question and this was outside the viewport, Atom would throw the aforementioned exception.

This pull-request addresses the above issue by explicitly ignoring block decorations that are located on rows that are not yet rendered.

/cc: @nathansobo @Ben3eeE @rsese @ungb

data.title: Expanded code-blocks overlap with previous code
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:

### Description

When expanding a collapsed code-block while the current viewport isn't scrollable (i.e. all code that is shown fits on the screen), the expanded code overlaps with the code right among it (See screenshot). Only re-opening the file helps.

**Reproduces how often:** Every time on the code I discovered it, never on some simple, short code.

### Versions

Atom    : 1.19.3
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

### Screenshot

![atomcollapsebug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11249519/30066809-51c86eac-9259-11e7-9ee7-7626f802ecaa.png)

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Array.prototype.indexOf called on null or undefined
data.body:
1. Open UI
2. Select one variable
3. Press go

**Atom**: 1.19.5 x64
**Electron**: 1.6.9
**OS**: Ubuntu 17.04
**Thrown From**: 'php-getters-setters-improved' package vundefined


### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Array.prototype.indexOf called on null or undefined

```
At /home/gabriel/.atom/packages/php-getters-setters-improved/lib/template-manager.coffee:32

TypeError: Array.prototype.indexOf called on null or undefined
    at indexOf (<anonymous>)
    at TemplateManager.module.exports.TemplateManager.determineTypeHint (/packages/php-getters-setters-improved/lib/template-manager.coffee:32:8)
    at TemplateManager.module.exports.TemplateManager.processVariable (/packages/php-getters-setters-improved/lib/template-manager.coffee:54:20)
    at TemplateManager.module.exports.TemplateManager.write (/packages/php-getters-setters-improved/lib/template-manager.coffee:66:17)
    at TemplateManager.module.exports.TemplateManager.writeGetter (/packages/php-getters-setters-improved/lib/template-manager.coffee:85:13)
    at Object.allGettersSetter (/packages/php-getters-setters-improved/lib/php-getters-setters-improved.coffee:111:20)
    at UIView.module.exports.UIView.generate (/packages/php-getters-setters-improved/lib/ui.view.coffee:73:15)
    at /packages/atom-sync/node_modules/space-pen/lib/space-pen.js:220:36)
    at HTMLButtonElement.dispatch (/packages/atom-autocomplete-php/node_modules/jquery/dist/jquery.js:4435:9)
    at HTMLButtonElement.elemData.handle (/packages/atom-autocomplete-php/node_modules/jquery/dist/jquery.js:4121:28)
```

### Commands

```
     -1:53.3.0 intentions:highlight (input.hidden-input)
     -1:53.1.0 fuzzy-finder:toggle-file-finder (input.hidden-input)
     -1:51.9.0 core:backspace (input.hidden-input)

data.title: Don't autoscroll when using the mouse to add, delete or move selections
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/15489

Previously, we used to scroll the editor on behalf of the user when clicking near the edges. This behavior was being perceived as jarring, because it would move up/down the line the user was trying to click:

![kapture 2017-09-05 at 15 23 22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/482957/30063198-2c6790b2-924e-11e7-9720-0d3cf676a932.gif)

With this pull-request we are restoring the behavior Atom 1.18 exhibited, which prevents the editor from auto-scrolling when using the mouse to add, delete or move selections:

![kapture 2017-09-05 at 15 25 24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/482957/30063285-766c9a9a-924e-11e7-8f0b-075e6ab0b35e.gif)

/cc: @nathansobo @ungb @Ben3eeE @50Wliu

        at jasmine.Spec.<anonymous> (/Users/distiller/atom/node_modules/language-html/spec/html-spec.coffee:67:27)


Finished in 2.767 seconds
31 tests, 113 assertions, 1 failure, 0 skipped
```

data.title: Atom interface is corrupted on macOS 10.11.6 on versions > 1.19.2
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Atom interface is completely corrupted (graphical glitches) after update to 1.19.3, 1.19.4 or 1.19.5.
--safe mode make no changes. Atom < 1.19.3 has no issues.
![untitled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16876990/30058142-5698b61a-9242-11e7-8167-6617f3387831.png)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update Atom to 1.19.3+.
2. Run Atom.
3. As soon as the application starts interface graphics is completely corrupted.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

Interface without graphical glitches.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

Interface is completely corrupted - not possible to use.

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]

100% - each time I launch Atom > 1.19.2.

### Versions

Atom    : 1.19.5
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

data.title: how to config when I open a reopen project in the current window as a different tab?
data.body:
I mean click 'File' -> 'reopen projects' -> [my project],
expected : [my project] be opened in current window as a different tab
actual: [my project] be opened in a new window.

Is there anything I need to set?

data.title: how to config when I open a reopen project in the current window as a different tab?
data.body:
I mean click 'File' -> 'reopen projects' -> [my project],
expected : [my project] be opened in current window as a different tab
actual: [my project] be opened in a new window.

I don't know why it doesn't work since this morning after I update my ATOM packages.
Is there anything I need to set?

BTW, my editor version is 1.19.5.

Thanks.

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '__reactInternalInstance$ct3ksqiu5dy54zl2szkf0f6r' of null
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Added Repo https://github.com/jamesleesaunders/d3.ez to Atom
2. View 'GitHub Tab'
3. There are strangely 4 Pull requests displayed which are already Closed. I don't know why these 4 PRs are listed. It will not let them be un-pinned either.
4. Click on PR#11
5. Click 'View Conversation' 
It then errors as below...

**Electron**: 1.6.9
**OS**: Mac OS X 10.12.5
